items.title: Judge blocks Trump administration from ending protections for Haitians
items.standfirst: A federal judge on Monday blocked the end of protections that have allowed roughly 350,000 Haitians to live in the U.S., dealing President Donald Trump's immigration agenda another legal setback.
items.content: A federal judge on Monday blocked the end of protections that have allowed roughly 350,000 Haitians to live in the U.S., dealing President Donald Trump's immigration agenda another legal setback.(Image credit: Luis Andres Henao)

items.title: US judge temporarily blocks lifting of deportation protections for Haiti migrants
items.standfirst: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration's attempt to end deportation protections for more than 350,000 Haitian immigrants, who are allowed to live and work in the US legally under Temporary Protected Status (TPS). A day before the TPS was set to lapse, US judge Ana Reyes…

A day before the TPS was set to lapse, US judge Ana Reyes…

items.title: US judge temporarily blocks lifting of deportation protections for Haiti migrants
items.standfirst: The judge said the Department of Homeland Security Secretary did not have facts or law on her side.
items.content: The judge said the Department of Homeland Security Secretary did not have facts or law on her side.

items.title: Judge blocks DHS from ending deportation protections for 350,000 Haitians
items.standfirst: A federal judge on Monday blocked the Trump administration from revoking Temporary Protected Status for Haitians, granting a last-minute reprieve to 350,000 immigrants who were set to lose protections on Tuesday.
items.content: A federal judge on Monday blocked the Trump administration from revoking Temporary Protected Status for Haitians, granting a last-minute reprieve to 350,000 immigrants who were set to lose protections on Tuesday.

items.title: Judge blocks Trump administration’s stripping of Haitians’ protected status
items.standfirst: Up to 350,000 Haitians legally live and work in the US due to being granted temporary protected statusA federal judge has blocked the Trump administration from stripping temporary protected status from up to 350,000 Haitians, a status that allows them to legally live and work in the United States amid the turmoil in their homeland.Judge Ana Reyes issued a temporary stay that prevents Kristi Noem, the US homeland security secretary, from implementing her decision to remove the status known as TPS, which was scheduled to expire on Tuesday. Continue reading...
items.content: Up to 350,000 Haitians legally live and work in the US due to being granted temporary protected statusA federal judge has blocked the Trump administration from stripping temporary protected status from up to 350,000 Haitians, a status that allows them to legally live and work in the United States amid the turmoil in their homeland.Judge Ana Reyes issued a temporary stay that prevents Kristi Noem, the US homeland security secretary, from implementing her decision to remove the status known as TPS, which was scheduled to expire on Tuesday. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A federal judge blocked the Trump administration from ending protections for Haitians
The decision affects roughly 350,000 Haitians living in the US
The judge ruled the Department of Homeland Security Secretary did not have facts or law on her side
The protections were set to lapse on Tuesday
The ruling is a legal setback for President Donald Trump's immigration agenda

items.title: Trump cuts India tariffs after Modi agrees to stop Russia oil purchases
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said on Monday he had struck a trade deal with India to cut tariffs after Prime Minister Narendra Modi pledged to halt purchases of Russia oil over the war in Ukraine. He said levies on Indian goods would fall to 18% from 25% under the agreement.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said on Monday he had struck a trade deal with India to cut tariffs after Prime Minister Narendra Modi pledged to halt purchases of Russia oil over the war in Ukraine. He said levies on Indian goods would fall to 18% from 25% under the agreement.

items.content: Tariffs will drop from 50% to 18% on Indian goods, while India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil.

items.content: US president had slapped India with a punitive 25% tariff for buying Russian oil on top of a 25% 'reciprocal' tariff.

Continue reading...
items.content: Detention of Marius Borg Høiby comes as Epstein files pile pressure on his mother, crown princess Mette-MaritThe son of Norway’s crown princess, Marius Borg Høiby, has been arrested on new charges just days before the start of his rape trial, as his mother continues to face questions over her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.The Oslo police district said Høiby had been arrested on Sunday evening on suspicion of assault, making threats with a knife and violating a restraining order. Continue reading...

items.title: Norway’s royal crisis: Crown princess faces Epstein scrutiny ahead of son’s rape trial
items.standfirst: Norway’s Crown Princess Mette-Marit is facing mounting scrutiny after her name appeared more than a thousand times in the latest batch of released documents related to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The revelations come as the princess’ son, Marius Borg Hoiby, faces 38 criminal charges, including rape, in a trial that is due to start Tuesday. Over the weekend, Hoiby was arrested again – this time on suspicion of threats, assault and for violating a restraining order, police said.
items.content: Norway’s Crown Princess Mette-Marit is facing mounting scrutiny after her name appeared more than a thousand times in the latest batch of released documents related to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The revelations come as the princess’ son, Marius Borg Hoiby, faces 38 criminal charges, including rape, in a trial that is due to start Tuesday. Over the weekend, Hoiby was arrested again – this time on suspicion of threats, assault and for violating a restraining order, police said.

ai_summary: The son of Norway's crown princess is facing a rape trial
Marius Borg Høiby is accused of 38 charges including four counts of rape
The trial is one of the biggest cases in Norway in recent years
The crown princess's son was arrested on new charges ahead of the trial
The case has put pressure on the royal family amid recent scandals

items.standfirst: Masoud Pezeshkian instructs foreign minister to seek negotiations with US as Trump warns ‘bad things would happen’ if no solution agreedIran’s president said on Tuesday that he had instructed his foreign minister to “pursue fair and equitable negotiations” with the US, as the two countries reportedly prepared to send top envoys to Istanbul for high-stakes talks on the Iranian nuclear programme later this week.President Masoud Pezeshkian said in a post on X: “I have instructed my minister of foreign affairs, provided that a suitable environment exists – one free from threats and unreasonable expectations – to pursue fair and equitable negotiations, guided by the principles of dignity, prudence, and expediency.” Continue reading...

items.title: China to ban hidden car door handles on all EVs over crash safety concerns
items.standfirst: Sleek car doors reduce vehicle drag but are prone to losing operability in the event of a crash, officials sayChina will soon ban concealed door handles on electric vehicles (EVs), becoming the first country to do so after several deadly incidents triggered global scrutiny of the controversial design first popularised by Tesla.According to regulations announced on Monday by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, cars sold in China will now be required to have a mechanical release on both the inside and outside of every door except the boot. items.title: The political fallout of the Epstein files
items.standfirst: After more than three million documents related to Jeffrey Epstein were released last Friday, tensions are growing across the globe. The disclosures have raised fresh questions about the convicted sex offender's relationships with the rich and powerful. Britain's former prince Andrew, his ex-wife Sarah Ferguson and career politician, Peter Mandelson, are among those who've been thrust back into the eye of the Jeffrey Epstein storm, after shocking, often intimate emails with the disgraced financier were released by the US Justice Department. Donald Trump, Elon Musk and Bill Gates were also mentioned in the tranche of three million documents. Sharon Gaffney spoke with Ian Reifowitz, distinguished professor at the State University of New York, about the latest on the fallout, and the reaction to the disclosures in the US.
items.content: After more than three million documents related to Jeffrey Epstein were released last Friday, tensions are growing across the globe. The disclosures have raised fresh questions about the convicted sex offender's relationships with the rich and powerful. Britain's former prince Andrew, his ex-wife Sarah Ferguson and career politician, Peter Mandelson, are among those who've been thrust back into the eye of the Jeffrey Epstein storm, after shocking, often intimate emails with the disgraced financier were released by the US Justice Department. Donald Trump, Elon Musk and Bill Gates were also mentioned in the tranche of three million documents. Sharon Gaffney spoke with Ian Reifowitz, distinguished professor at the State University of New York, about the latest on the fallout, and the reaction to the disclosures in the US.

ai_summary: Sarah Ferguson's charity is closing amid new revelations about her friendship with Jeffrey Epstein
The charity will close "for the foreseeable future"
New documents have revealed intimate emails between Ferguson and Epstein
The closure is seen as a consequence of the ongoing fallout from the Epstein scandal
Ferguson's friendship with Epstein has raised questions about her judgment

clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Unveils $12bn Critical Minerals Stockpile Scheme

items.title: Trump unveils $12bn critical minerals stockpile scheme in apparent move to counter China’s dominance
items.standfirst: Other countries are expected to join Project Vault, which US president said would ensure that US businesses are ‘never harmed by any shortage’Donald Trump has announced the creation of a critical mineral reserve worth nearly $12bn, a stockpile that could counter China’s ability to use its dominance of the hard-to-process metals as leverage in trade talks.“Today we’re launching what will be known as Project Vault to ensure that American businesses and workers are never harmed by any shortage,” Trump said at the White House on Monday. Continue reading...
items.content: Other countries are expected to join Project Vault, which US president said would ensure that US businesses are ‘never harmed by any shortage’Donald Trump has announced the creation of a critical mineral reserve worth nearly $12bn, a stockpile that could counter China’s ability to use its dominance of the hard-to-process metals as leverage in trade talks.“Today we’re launching what will be known as Project Vault to ensure that American businesses and workers are never harmed by any shortage,” Trump said at the White House on Monday. Continue reading...

items.title: What is the US critical minerals stockpile?
items.standfirst: President Trump said the stockpile would 'ensure that American businesses and workers are never harmed by any shortage'.
items.content: President Trump said the stockpile would 'ensure that American businesses and workers are never harmed by any shortage'.

ai_summary: Trump announces $12bn critical minerals stockpile
Project Vault aims to counter China's dominance
US businesses will have access to essential minerals
Stockpile will help prevent shortages and trade issues
Trump says it will ensure American businesses are protected

clusters.title: Details after Democrat Taylor Rehmet pulls off major upset in Texas
clusters.neutral_headline: Democrat Taylor Rehmet Wins Texas State Senate Seat

items.title: Details after Democrat Taylor Rehmet pulls off major upset in Texas
items.standfirst: Democrat Taylor Rehmet was able to score a Texas State Senate seat in a special election over the weekend by flipping a district President Trump won by 17 points in 2024. CBS News' Fin Gomez has more.
items.content: Democrat Taylor Rehmet was able to score a Texas State Senate seat in a special election over the weekend by flipping a district President Trump won by 17 points in 2024. CBS News' Fin Gomez has more.

items.title: Democrats win special elections in Texas. How significant is it for Trump?
items.standfirst: US president dismisses Taylor Rehmet’s Texas State Senate victory as a ‘local’ race.
items.content: US president dismisses Taylor Rehmet’s Texas State Senate victory as a ‘local’ race.

ai_summary: Taylor Rehmet wins Texas State Senate seat in upset
Democrat flips district won by Trump in 2024
Rehmet's victory is seen as significant for Trump
Trump dismisses victory as a local race
Democrats win special elections in Texas

clusters.title: Kennedy Center to close for construction for 2 years, Trump says
clusters.neutral_headline: Kennedy Center to Close for Two Years

items.title: Kennedy Center to close for construction for 2 years, Trump says
items.standfirst: Complete closure of the performing arts center in Washington, D.C., will start on July 4, Mr. Trump said. It's not yet clear how extensive the changes to the building might be.
items.content: Complete closure of the performing arts center in Washington, D.C., will start on July 4, Mr. Trump said. It's not yet clear how extensive the changes to the building might be.

items.title: Trump to close Kennedy Center for two years - sparking more controversy over DC venue
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has said the Kennedy Center will close for two years in plans that are fuelling the growing controversy over the Washington DC arts venue.
items.content: Donald Trump has said the Kennedy Center will close for two years in plans that are fuelling the growing controversy over the Washington DC arts venue.

ai_summary: Kennedy Center will close for two years
Closure starts on July 4 for construction
Changes to the building are not yet clear
Trump announces closure plans
Controversy surrounds the DC arts venue

clusters.title: Populist conservative Laura Fernández wins Costa Rica's presidential election
clusters.neutral_headline: Laura Fernández Wins Costa Rica Presidential Election

items.title: Populist conservative Laura Fernández wins Costa Rica's presidential election
items.standfirst: Candidate Laura Fernández won a resounding victory, promising to continue the aggressive reorienting of the Central American nation's politics started by her predecessor.
items.content: Candidate Laura Fernández won a resounding victory, promising to continue the aggressive reorienting of the Central American nation's politics started by her predecessor.(Image credit: Carlos Borbon)

items.title: Fernández wins Costa Rican presidency, steering Latin America further right
items.standfirst: Rightwing populist elected in landslide after promising to crack down on rising violence linked to cocaine tradeThe rightwing populist Laura Fernández has won Costa Rica’s presidential election in a landslide after promising to crack down on rising violence linked to the cocaine trade.Fernández’s nearest rival, centre-right economist Álvaro Ramos, conceded defeat as results showed the ruling party far exceeding the threshold of 40% needed to avoid a runoff. Continue reading...
items.content: Rightwing populist elected in landslide after promising to crack down on rising violence linked to cocaine tradeThe rightwing populist Laura Fernández has won Costa Rica’s presidential election in a landslide after promising to crack down on rising violence linked to the cocaine trade.Fernández’s nearest rival, centre-right economist Álvaro Ramos, conceded defeat as results showed the ruling party far exceeding the threshold of 40% needed to avoid a runoff. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Laura Fernández wins Costa Rica presidential election
Rightwing populist promises to crack down on violence
Fernández wins in landslide victory
Promises to address rising violence and cocaine trade
Centre-right economist concedes defeat

clusters.title: Syria security forces enter strategic al-Hassakeh as part of deal with Kurdish-led SDF
clusters.neutral_headline: Syria Security Forces Enter Al-Hassakeh City

items.title: Syria security forces enter strategic al-Hassakeh as part of deal with Kurdish-led SDF
items.standfirst: Forces reporting to Syria’s interior ministry on Monday entered the strategic city of al-Hassakeh in the northeast as part of an agreement with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). Under the deal, the security forces were given permission to enter two Kurdish-controlled cities in exchange for integrating SDF and its administration into the central government.
items.content: Forces reporting to Syria’s interior ministry on Monday entered the strategic city of al-Hassakeh in the northeast as part of an agreement with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). Under the deal, the security forces were given permission to enter two Kurdish-controlled cities in exchange for integrating SDF and its administration into the central government.

items.title: Syrian forces deploy in Hasakah under ceasefire agreement with SDF
items.standfirst: Syrian forces move into the northeastern city, which was previously under the control of the Kurdish-led SDF.
items.content: Syrian forces move into the northeastern city, which was previously under the control of the Kurdish-led SDF.

ai_summary: Syria security forces enter al-Hassakeh city
Deal made with Kurdish-led SDF for entry
Security forces will integrate SDF into government
SDF will be part of central government administration
Ceasefire agreement allows for peaceful entry

clusters.title: Fifa president Infantino apologises for jokes about British fans
clusters.neutral_headline: Fifa President Apologizes for Jokes About British Fans

items.title: Fifa president Infantino apologises for jokes about British fans
items.standfirst: Fifa president Gianni Infantino apologises for controversial comments he made about British football supporters which were criticised by fan groups.
items.content: Fifa president Gianni Infantino apologises for controversial comments he made about British football supporters which were criticised by fan groups.

items.title: World football chief issues apology to British fans after 'cheap joke'
items.standfirst: The president of world football's governing body FIFA has apologised to British football fans after a comment which was criticised as a "cheap joke" by the Football Supporters' Association.
items.content: The president of world football's governing body FIFA has apologised to British football fans after a comment which was criticised as a "cheap joke" by the Football Supporters' Association.

ai_summary: Fifa president apologizes for comments on British fans
Jokes were criticized by fan groups
Infantino says sorry for controversial remarks
Football Supporters' Association criticizes comments
Apology issued for hurt caused to British fans
